main event: On February 16, 1955, a radar operator observed an unidentified flying object traveling at approximately 2000 miles per hour near Kings Landing, California.
interesting points: The object was initially spotted on radar 15 miles off the coast of California., It made three 90-degree turns during its flight, which is considered unusual for known aircraft., The observer deemed the object approximately the size of a small aircraft., The object emitted no sound or trail during its observation., The witness was later interviewed and considered reliable and competent.
witness description: radar operator at Otis Air Force Base
